lines.text: Do you realize I have the power to release you or have you crucified?
You wouldn't have had that power over me if it hadn't been given to you from above.

[having denied Jesus thrice]
Oh God... oh God...
[shouting]
My God! Please, help me!

[seeing the Baby Jesus for the first time]
Now I can die contented, Lord, according to Thy will.
[gently, to the Virgin Mary]
And a sword shall pierce your heart.
John if I set you free, what would you do with your freedom?
I would follow the one whose way I have prepared, like so many others who already follow him, but you will not set me free.
[discussing the idea of Jesus' being born in a stable]
And yet, I see the justice of it.
Not in glory, but in humility.
And we go on sinning. And very pleasant it is, too.
What is the heart of the law?
"Hear, O Israel, thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, with all thy soul and with all thy strength." This is the greatest commandment.
you must love your neighbor as yourself.
Destroy this temple, and in three days I will make it rise again.
It took centuries to build this temple. Do you think you can build it again in three days?
You have said it, but you have not understood.

[indignant]
Rabbi, I understand better than you *think*.

[Peter is drunk]
Andrew. Andrew, I'm not like you. I'm not a follower of priests and prophets; I'm a fisherman. I've got my family to think of. You followed the Baptist, now follow this one...

[grabbing Peter's Arm]
Peter!

[wresting free]
Just leave me alone! Why did you bring Him here to me?
[grabbing his net]
*This* is my life! My nets... my boat.
[shouting]
Go on! Follow Him! But leave me!
Come on, you can't talk to him when he's like this.
[motioning the others to leave]
Come on, Philip.
